intro: Lesquerella gracilis var. sessilis, commonly known as the slender lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, sessile leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Lesquerella gracilis var. sessilis is valued for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its oil-rich seeds.
